intro: Oreocnide rhodopleura, commonly known as the red-veined evergreen, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its glossy, elliptical leaves with prominent red veins. The plant produces small, inconspicuous greenish-yellow flowers arranged in clusters. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland and mountainous forests. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens and greenhouses for its attractive foliage.
